title: Clarify unsupported 'Web control' role requests with in-app guidance

requirements.summary: Clarify in Roles & Access panel that 'Web control' / 'World Wide Web Controller' is not supported and guide users to supported roles and next steps.
acceptanceCriteria: Roles & Access panel text explicitly mentions that "Web control" / "World Wide Web Controller" is not a supported role name in this app.
The UI clearly states (in English) that only these roles exist: App Controller, Security, ICP Controller.

The UI provides a clear next step: instruct the user to share their Principal ID with the App Controller to request either the Security role (for security/audit features) or the ICP Controller role (for ICP operations).

file_operations.description: Update the "Supported Roles" section copy to explicitly call out that "Web control" / "World Wide Web Controller" is not a supported role in this application; explicitly list App Controller, Security, and ICP Controller as the only roles; and add clear next-step guidance to share the user's Principal ID with the App Controller to request Security (security/audit) or ICP Controller (ICP operations). Use the authorization component's role-based access guidance patterns (copy/UX only). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Update Access Denied screen guidance for authenticated-but-unauthorized users to explicitly note 'Web control' is not supported and direct them to request Security or ICP Controller access.
acceptanceCriteria: When an authenticated user sees Access Denied, the page includes a sentence stating that "Web control" is not a supported role in this application.
The page continues to show the userâ€™s Principal ID and one-click copy, and the guidance text recommends requesting Security or ICP Controller from the App Controller.

file_operations.description: Adjust authenticated Access Denied copy to: (1) explicitly state that "Web control" / "World Wide Web Controller" access cannot be granted because it is not a supported role in this app; (2) recommend requesting Security or ICP Controller access from the App Controller; and (3) keep the Principal ID display and one-click copy behavior intact. Align messaging with the authorization component's AccessDeniedScreen guidance approach (copy/UX only). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
